name: apimversioned

author: Stephane Eyskens

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to configure before running PowerShell

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select resource group which contains the API portal

inputs.name: ApiPortalName
inputs.label: API Portal
inputs.helpMarkDown: The API Portal you want to deploy against

inputs.name: UseProductCreatedByPreviousTask
inputs.label: Product created by previous task
inputs.helpMarkDown: Make sure the task that creates/updates the product is not disabled and that it is executed by the same agent.

inputs.name: product1
inputs.label: Product
inputs.helpMarkDown: Product you want to add the API to.

inputs.name: Authorization
inputs.label: Authorization
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable Authorization for the developer portal

inputs.name: oauth
inputs.label: Authorization server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authorization server to associate to the API

inputs.name: oid
inputs.label: OpenID Connect
inputs.helpMarkDown: OpenID provider to associate to the API

inputs.name: SwaggerPicker
inputs.label: Swagger location
inputs.helpMarkDown: How should the API version be transmitted by consumers

inputs.name: swaggerlocation
inputs.label: Swagger Location URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Make sure the URL is connectable from the build servers

inputs.name: swaggerartifact
inputs.label: Swagger Artifact
inputs.helpMarkDown: Swagger Artifact. For instance $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/<yourswagger.json>

inputs.name: swaggercode
inputs.label: Swagger body
inputs.helpMarkDown: Insert the full swagger definition

inputs.name: targetapi
inputs.label: API Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: New or existing API

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: API Version

inputs.name: scheme

inputs.name: VersionHeader
inputs.label: Version Header
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version Header

inputs.name: QueryParam
inputs.label: Version query parameter
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version query parameter

inputs.name: pathapi
inputs.label: API URL suffix
inputs.helpMarkDown: API URL suffix

inputs.name: TemplateSelector
inputs.label: Start from Policy Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally choose a starting policy template to apply to the API

inputs.name: CacheLookup
inputs.label: Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default Cache Lookup Policy. Mind that this will replace any existing policy for that API. Add other policies manually if necessary!

inputs.name: Basic
inputs.label: Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default Basic Policy. Mind that this will replace any existing policy for that API. Add other policies manually if necessary!

inputs.name: CORS
inputs.label: Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default CORS Policy. Mind that this will replace any existing policy for that API. Add other policies manually if necessary!

inputs.name: JWT
inputs.label: Policy
inputs.defaultValue:
<policies>
	<inbound>
		<validate-jwt header-name='Insert HTTP Header Name here' failed-validation-httpcode='401' failed-validation-error-message='Unauthorized'>
			<issuer-signing-keys><key>Base64 Encoded Key 1</key>
			</issuer-signing-keys>
			<audiences><audience>Audience 1</audience>
			</audiences>
		<issuers>
			<issuer>Issuer 1</issuer>
		</issuers>
		<required-claims><claim name='claim1' match='all'><value>value1</value><value>value2</value></claim>
			</required-claims>
		</validate-jwt>
		<base />
	</inbound>
	<backend>
		<base />
	</backend>
	<outbound>
		<base />
	</outbound>
	<on-error>
		<base />
	</on-error>
</policies>
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default JWT validation Policy. Mind that this will replace any existing policy for that API. Add other policies manually if necessary!

inputs.name: IP
inputs.label: Policy

inputs.name: RateByKey
inputs.label: Policy

inputs.name: QuotaByKey
inputs.label: Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default Quota by key Policy. Mind that this will replace any existing policy for that API. Add other policies manually if necessary!

inputs.name: HeaderCheck
inputs.label: Policy
inputs.defaultValue:
<policies>
	<inbound>
		<check-header name='header name' failed-check-httpcode='http status code to return on failure' failed-check-error-message='error message to return' ignore-case='true | false'>
			<value>value</value>
		</check-header>
		<base />
	</inbound>
	<backend>
		<base />
	</backend>
	<outbound>
		<base />
	</outbound>
	<on-error>
		<base />
	</on-error>
</policies>
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default Header Check Policy. Mind that this will replace any existing policy for that API. Add other policies manually if necessary!
